sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2a
sentence.text: yere!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2c
sentence.text: Anansi gwe

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2e
sentence.text: alen kon tranga

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 2g
sentence.text: den ben sidon na ini den boto

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3a
sentence.text: Anansi no ben abi notnoti

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3c
sentence.text: mi e teki a patu wawan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3e
sentence.text: mi e marki a watra nanga mi finga
sentence.gloss: I measure the water with my finger

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 3g
sentence.text: a basya ben e wipi den srefsrefi nanga langa wipi
sentence.gloss: the boss would whip them mercilessly with a long whip

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 4b
sentence.text: ala den sma e taigi pikinnengre, un no naki en
sentence.gloss: all the people tell the children, 'do not hit it'

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 4d
sentence.text: yu kan taigi en odi gi mi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 5b
sentence.text: a dei dati Tigri ben o kon tu
sentence.gloss: that day Tiger would come too

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 6
sentence.text: na kon yu e kon na mi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 7b
sentence.text: Anansi no kan go drape moro

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 9a
sentence.text: San yu tyari kon gi mi?
sentence.gloss: What did you bring for me?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 9c
sentence.text: Oten yu o gi mi moni baka?
sentence.gloss: When will you give me the money back?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 10b
sentence.text: i wan dringi pikin biri?
sentence.gloss: Would you like to drink some beer?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 11a
sentence.text: Gwe!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 11c
sentence.text: Un no naki en!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 12b
sentence.text: a no doti

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 13a
sentence.text: a ben pikin

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 13c
sentence.text: wan sma o de swanger

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 14a
sentence.text: a faya tumsi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 15a
sentence.text: mi oso moro bigi leki dati
sentence.gloss: my house is bigger than that

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 15c
sentence.text: Kenneth bigi psa twee meter
sentence.gloss: Kenneth is taller than two meters

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 16b
sentence.text: nownow wroko no de

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 17a
sentence.text: en fesnen na Christoforus

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 17c
sentence.text: a ben de wan bun datra

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 18a
sentence.text: en na mi mati

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 19a
sentence.text: den tu sma disi na Sranansma

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 20
sentence.text: Ma den srafu di ben e kon den no ben abi a srefi leti
sentence.gloss: But the slaves who came didn't have the same rights

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 22a
sentence.text: a buku disi na fu mi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 22c
sentence.text: a tori disi na fu srafuten na ini Sranan
sentence.gloss: this story is about the time of slavery in Suriname

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 23b
sentence.text: ef' a ben e nyan furu dan a ben sa kon moro bigi
sentence.gloss: if he had eaten a lot then he would have become bigger

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 24b
sentence.text: a e kon fatu

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 25a
sentence.text: a strati tron wan liba

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 25c
sentence.text: san yu wani tron te yu kon bigi?
sentence.gloss: what do you want to be when you grow up?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 26b
sentence.text: a tori disi san mi e go taki tide na fu srafuten
sentence.gloss: this story that I'm going to tell today is about slavery

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 26d
sentence.text: a kamra pe den ben e tan ben dungru
sentence.gloss: the room where they stayed was dark

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 27b
sentence.text: mi e poti en ini a patu noso mi e poti en ini a pan
sentence.gloss: I put it in the pot or I put it in the pan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 27d
sentence.text: te mi e luku efu a gari of mi e smeri en son leisi
sentence.gloss: when I look to see if it's done or I smell it sometimes

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 28b
sentence.text: wan dei Anansi no ben abi notnoti fu gi sisa Akuba
sentence.gloss: one day Anansi did not have anything to give sister Akuba

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 30a
sentence.text: someni ben dede fu di den no ben kisi wan bun yepi
sentence.gloss: so many people died because they didn't receive good care

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 30c
sentence.text: mi e spuru a patu pikinso want kande kakalaka noso wan sani go ini a patu
sentence.gloss: I rinse the pot a little because maybe a cockroach or something went in it

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 32
sentence.text: nanga aladi den ben e wroko so tranga toku den ben kisi fonfon
sentence.gloss: even though they worked so hard, nevertheless they got thrashings

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 33b
sentence.text: di a waka na ini a busi a doro wan pikin kampu
sentence.gloss: when he walked in the forest he came to a small hut

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 33d
sentence.text: sodrai yu si en ala den sma e taigi pikinnengre, un no naki en
sentence.gloss: as soon as you see it all the people tell the children, don't hit it

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 34b
sentence.text: a man dati ben e meki muiti meki furu srafu kon fri
sentence.gloss: that man tried hard to set many slaves free

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 35b
sentence.text: meki a luku!

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 37
sentence.text: Anansi taki 'mi abi wan sani dya...'

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 38b
sentence.text: mi wani ferteri unu taki someni fri srafu kisi leri
sentence.gloss: I want to tell you that many free slaves got an education

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 38d
sentence.text: a si taki na Anansi
sentence.gloss: he saw that it was Anansi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 39b
sentence.text: a aleisi e sori dati a kba bori
sentence.gloss: the rice shows that it's done cooking

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 40a
sentence.text: yu no e si suma e koiri?
sentence.gloss: Don't you see who is wandering about?

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 41a
sentence.text: Ontiman drai luku

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 41c
sentence.text: mi e teki en poti ini a pan
sentence.gloss: I take it and put it in the pan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 41e
sentence.text: a fel a tigri drei a buba fu a tigri
sentence.gloss: he skinned the tiger and dried its pelt

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 42a
sentence.text: Ontiman lon gwe

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 42c
sentence.text: mi e kanti a aleisi go ini na patu
sentence.gloss: I pour the rice into the pot

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 42e
sentence.text: Ba Tigri now kren esesi go na tapu a kronto bon
sentence.gloss: Brother Tiger now climbed quickly to the top of the coconut tree

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 43b
sentence.text: wan oso

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 43d
sentence.text: mi famiri oso

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 44b
sentence.text: furu gowtu ben de drape

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 45
sentence.text: ala den boi doti

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 46b
sentence.text: mi e teki dri kan aleisi
sentence.gloss: I take three cups of rice

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 47a
sentence.text: wan moi pikin grun wan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 48a
sentence.text: tra kondre sma

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 49a
sentence.text: den si den ingi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 49c
sentence.text: a doro wan pikin kampu
sentence.gloss: he came to a small hut

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 49e
sentence.text: dati na a triki fu en

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 50a
sentence.text: someni ben dede

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 51a
sentence.text: a sani dati

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 52
sentence.text: A man Pengel

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 53b
sentence.text: a pikin boi fu mi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 53d
sentence.text: dati a wan nengre leki den srefi
sentence.gloss: that was a negro like themselves

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 54.
sentence.text: a tori disi san mi e go taki tide
sentence.gloss: this story that I'm going to tell today

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 55b
sentence.text: a di fu tu neti dati

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 56a
sentence.text: gi mi wan dala botrofisi
sentence.gloss: give me 2,50's worth of butter fish

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 56c
sentence.text: gi mi tu ipi tomati
sentence.gloss: give me two stacks of tomatoes

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 57b
sentence.text: a moro bunkopu oto

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 58b
sentence.text: a buba fu a tigri

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 59b
sentence.text: Charles oto

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 60a
sentence.text: a triki

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 60c
sentence.text: a triki fu en

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 62a
sentence.text: den srafu fu den

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 63a
sentence.text: mi e teki a pan noso a patu
sentence.gloss: I take the pan or the pot

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 63c
sentence.text: Anansi ben prei wan triki nanga Kakalaka nanga Kafowru
sentence.gloss: Anansi played a trick on Cockroach and Chicken

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 64b
sentence.text: yu no ben abi soso takru srafumasra nanga srafumisi
sentence.gloss: you didn't have only mean slave masters and mistresses

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 65b
sentence.text: trawan kan naki yu wan ston broko yu ede
sentence.gloss: the other person can crack your skull with a rock

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 67
sentence.text: a ferteri wan tori fu Anansi nanga Tigri
sentence.gloss: he told a story about Anansi and Tiger

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 69
sentence.text: agama na wan pikin sani leki wan pikin legwana
sentence.gloss: an agama is a little thing like a small iguana

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 71a
sentence.text: mi e go na a aleisisaka

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 71c
sentence.text: dan yu e tan tapu a kronto bon
sentence.gloss: then stay at the top of the coconut tree

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 71e
sentence.text: a tori disi na fu srafuten na ini Sranan
sentence.gloss: this story is about the time of slavery in Suriname

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 72b
sentence.text: yu mus bribi na tapu Gado

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73b
sentence.text: dan a lon a teki en gon
sentence.gloss: then he ran and took his gun

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73d
sentence.text: ma mi sa luku ini a oso
sentence.gloss: but I'll look in the house

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 73f
sentence.text: a ben e krin wan konkoni

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 74a
sentence.text: mi e gwe.

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 74c
sentence.text: mi sa gwe.

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 75b
sentence.text: Anansi ben mus pai mi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 75d
sentence.text: dan a no abi fu pai Tigri moro
sentence.gloss: then he won't have to pay Tiger anymore

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 76b
sentence.text: mi wani bori aleisi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 77b
sentence.text: di den kba nyan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 78a
sentence.text: a bol kon langa

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 79a
sentence.text: krin a dyari gi mi

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 80
sentence.text: na Ontiman ben e sidon

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 82a
sentence.text: a koti ensrefi nanga wan nefi
sentence.gloss: he cuts himself with a knife

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 83a
sentence.text: yu no abi fu pai mi moro
sentence.gloss: you don't have to pay me anymore

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 84a
sentence.text: na en ben feni Sranan

sentence.source: Nickel, Marilyn; Wilner, John. Papers on Sranan Tongo. n.d. Summer Institute of Linguistics. Example 84
sentence.text: a den eigi srafu leki densrefi ben mus yepi den
sentence.gloss: their own slaves like themselves had to help them
